Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and room is clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: Williamwl
Reviews.Content: Stay 2 nights, surround with variety food choice , near tiong bahru hawker center with overnight car park （pay by cash card or vep pass) , from hotel to attraction sentosa,marina bay sands or china town taxi fares less SGD 12.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms with unfriendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: Harry2030101
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen because of the location.And near to the MRT Station. Finding the hotel was not hard, since almost all the taxi driver knew this area and hotel well. The lobby was so tiny, that makes the early check-in guest quite hard to put the luggage first before the official check in time. The room was small, it's okay, since we don't expect more than that. But the bathroom was so tiny, that we would make the whole bathroom (wash basin, toilet bowl,mirror and our hung personal toileteries soaked well when we took shower. Hot/Warm water was very unstable, sometimes boiling hot, frozen cold in the same time. Couldn't maintain the hot water more than 5 minutes. The TV simply just like decoration on the wall. It's LCD ok, but hardly found any watchable channel, first only very few channels available, secondly the channel available were only raining and marching ants only. The staffs were different issue, they were all so unfriendly, hardly ever smiled, hardly ever communicate. Only few words spoken. Unfortunately, since the location was very strategic and very close to the MRT Station, we could forget those kinds of dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for getting around the city”
Reviews.Author: BelleLSW
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to the MRT station, bus stop and food court/eateries. Conveniently located for easy traveling to and fro the city and also Sentosa Island. Rooms are tiny and clean. Don't expect much from budget hotel even though this one in particular is more expensive compared to the other 81 hotels because of the good location. Excellent for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms & a lot of noise”
Reviews.Author: SweetHeartScene
Reviews.Content: It is a budget hotel so you can't really expect all that much for the price. In my mind it was on par with a private room in a hostel. Staff: fantastic! They were always friendly and helpful whenever we needed them and let us borrow a multi-plug so we could plug a lot of things in. Location: really close to both Outram Park and China Town subway stations. The neighborhood is safe and has a few little stores near by. Rooms: Fairly small. A wet room bathroom and a small desk. Only one accessible power socket. The bed was made from leather which while practical was annoying to sleep on. Honestly? I wouldn't have had a quibble with the room as they give you black out curtains, big tv, good wifi Internet and although the rooms are small it was big enough for the two of us considering we only wanted to sleep there. The only thing that let the hotel down was the noise. Anyone walking past our room talking sounded like they were shouting. The worst was a small child one morning playing in the hallway. Overall I did enjoy my stay here and if coming back to Singapore on the same budget I probably would stay here again for the location and price alone.

Reviews.Title: “I will not come again”
Reviews.Author: Dickylcw
Reviews.Content: Services was very poor at all, the towels was dirtied, one time teeth brush, (powder on teeth brush) Reception kept room key, no mini bar, very poor Internet signal, needed login I'd and password, 2persons but 1login only, stayed 2days but only 1day Internet pass, Receptions attitudes extremely poor. Eng hoon road hotel Osaka 81

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small room without a window;”
Reviews.Author: Frank85K
Reviews.Content: Good location with station 5-10mins and Chinatown 10-15mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms! Internet only in lobby area”
Reviews.Author: robledo
Reviews.Content: I was a bit reluctant to book Hotel 81 having read review of the other chains but went ahead anyway. Overall an okay stay The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from the station Outram Park and maybe 20-25 mins walk to China town on foot. Rooms were tiny but clean. TV remote control didn`t work and staff didn`t seem bothered about it. Maybe it`s a common issue with other rooms also. The other negative is WIFI only in the lobby. I believe the hotel is overpriced for the location and the size of the room but this is Singapore and nothing comes very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped hotel”
Reviews.Author: alextttc
Reviews.Content: We checked in on 6/30-7/4/11 The room is really cramped even without a table or chair which concide with other travallers review here.The toilet room with shower facility which only fit for one person standing and no space left other than u can touch even wall by hands.That's mean even the shower room is very small too.Yet it doesn't mean bad at all.It's relatively cheaper price and good clean room service quite appreciated.two bottle of distilled water available daily.a convenience shop just outside the hotels door.Many tourists stayed in there as well.Tiong Bahru good center 5mins walk.Many food can choose from.there's coffee good.some shop have to queue up for a while. nearby the hotels still have many chinese cuisines.To get there just take Outram park and Exit-B which closest to get to the hotel~

Reviews.Title: “Will b back!”
Reviews.Author: ThiNThuTRAN
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TA, I only booked for 2 nights out of 6 I was there (Singapore - HK - Singapore) the rooms were adequate for myself and my daughter. Who needs so much room when Ur on holiday! U only need a clean bed and decent shower! The bed a quite firm ( but I like firm) I think if my 7 year old daughter is not complaining then it's ok!! I ended up booking the last 4 nights there too!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, clean, well worth a try, On my would stay again list.”
Reviews.Author: pompeii
Reviews.Content: Very small room, no storage space for suitcases, however we had read previous reviews so we booked knowing this. Tiny shower room/toilet but perfectly adequate. Very clean both in public areas and in the room, very secure all public areas monitored by cctv. We were able to get a transfer from the airport for S$9 each, found plenty of eateries round about. Well worth a try if you are trying to keep costs down. Noise was the only problem proberbly due to the hard floors so door banging and people talking in the corridors did wake us a couple of times. Found the reception staff helpful when needed. Housekeeping very good. If we go back to Singapore we will go back to Hotel 81 Osaka.

Reviews.Title: “close to mrt, but such small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: seshpesh
Reviews.Content: i was really shocked when i walked in this room, i'd read reviews saying that the rooms were small, but i had no idea just how tiny they really were, shoebox describes it well! the beds arent even full sized, my partner didnt fit, the mattress is leather so every time you turn over its really loud, we both woke up with the sorest necks & backs. no room in the cupboard for anything bigger than hand luggage. i wouldnt stay here again, for half the price you can find much better rooms! friendly staff, clean but bad overpriced rooms. tiny rooms, noisy & uncomfortable leather mattress which wasnt even a full size mattress if your taller than 5'10 your legs will hang over the end! the only positive was how close it was to mrt & the tiong bahru market is a 5minute walk away, the second floor is a hawker center you can eat for as little as $2! such yummy food!

Reviews.Title: “clean but small”
Reviews.Author: okeila
Reviews.Content: i think it's quite a new hotel. rooms are clean. my room has a trouble with internet connection. no fridge in rooms. relatively expensive compared to same hotel chain hotels in geylang area

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 81 - Osaka
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Eng Hoon Street, Singapore 169753, Singapore
